markdownRemark.html:
It has been some time since I wanted to make my own website in order to write articles and share my work.

As a Web developer, I have tried to build it from scratch but it was a lot of work and, while feasible, I never got the motivation to ever build something to the end. Even though I could use all the fancy technologies that I could dream of, like PureScript or Elm, I really never had such a need for a website so as to spend so much time making it. Basically I wanted to build a blog where I'd write articles as Markdown and that would render thoses pages. In the end, I always spent too much time on the design and not the functionality and dropped the project.

Today, I don't know why really, I got motivated again, and I decided to use something I had heard of: GatsbyJs.

It was so easy and quick to setup, and the documentation was really great in order to do exactly what I wanted. I barely had to think at all !

It does what I want : I can make my own specific pages with HTML/React, and I can render my articles using a template made with React and writing the content in Markdown. Plus, the hot reloading is working and I think I got SSR (Server Side Rendering) for free !

Here is the result. I wouldn't say that I'm proud of it since I did nearly nothing, but I am glad that finally things took a turn for the better and that such amazing framework like GatsbyJs were made.

So I'll say it: thank you, people at GatsbyJs !

frontmatter.title: Thank you Gatsby
frontmatter.abstract: How I finally got a blog working in 5 minutes.
